column4: hello, I need help to uninstall/reinstall gtk. anybody up for it?
because I've installed version 2.8.1, for some reason, and now the two versions are interfering with each other, so I can't install any programs that need gtk...
how the heck did you manage that?
I really don't have a clue, been having the problem for some weeks now, I can't even remember why I did it...
did you add any unofficial repos to your /etc/apt/sources.list?
any way to check if it works, without installing anything?
the reason your gtk is broken is that you have used unofficial repos, they can break your system as you have done
actually, I think it's because I somehow install gtk 2.8.1... but now I can't rewind.
which is what I just said
heh, fair. but the problem isn't solved: 'pkg-config --modversion glib-2.0' returned 2.8.1, but GLIB (2.6.3)
was found! If pkg-config was correct
